### Exercise: French Vegetable Nouns and Gender

Practice the gender of French vegetable nouns and their articles.

#### 1. Assign the correct definite article (*le/la/l'*) to each vegetable:

\_\_\_ ail (garlic) 🧄 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'l\'')">

\_\_\_ carotte (carrot) 🥕 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la')">

\_\_\_ brocoli (broccoli) 🥦 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le')">

\_\_\_ courgette (zucchini) 🥒 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la')">

\_\_\_ champignon (mushroom) 🍄 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'/les" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le')">

\_\_\_ épinards (spinach) 🍃 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'les')">[(plural!)]{style="margin-left:10px;"}

\_\_\_ oignon (onion) 🧅 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'l\'')">

\_\_\_ pomme de terre (potato) 🥔 → <input type="text" placeholder="le/la/l'" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la')">

#### 2. Match the French term to its English equivalent:

**"l’artichaut"** 🥬 → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'artichoke')">

**"le chou-fleur"** 🥦 → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'cauliflower')">

**"la betterave"** 🍠 → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'beet')">

**"les haricots verts"** 🫘 → <input type="text" placeholder="English" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'green beans')">

#### 3. Fill in the blanks with the correct term:

"\_\_\_ (The cucumber) est frais." 🥒 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le concombre')">

"J’achète \_\_\_ (tomatoes) au marché." 🍅 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'des tomates')">

"\_\_\_ (The beet) est rouge." 🍠 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la betterave')">

"Nous cuisinons \_\_\_ (spinach) ce soir." 🍃 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'des épinards')">

"Elle préfère \_\_\_ (the mushroom)." 🍄 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le champignon')">

"\_\_\_ (The carrot) est orange." 🥕 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'la carotte')">

"Il coupe \_\_\_ (the onion)." 🧅 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'l\'oignon')">

"Nous mangeons \_\_\_ (potatoes) avec du poulet." 🥔 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'des pommes de terre')">

"Tu ajoutes \_\_\_ (the garlic) à la sauce." 🧄 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'l\'ail')">

"Elles aiment \_\_\_ (green beans)." 🫘 → <input type="text" placeholder="French" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'les haricots verts')">

#### 4. Correct the errors in gender/number:

"Un courgette" 🥒 → <input type="text" placeholder="Correct phrase" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'une courgette')">

"La maïs" 🌽 → <input type="text" placeholder="Correct phrase" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'le maïs')">

"Des haricot" 🫘 → <input type="text" placeholder="Correct phrase" oninput="checkAnswer(this, 'des haricots')">

```{=html}
<script>
function checkAnswer(input, correctAnswer) {
    const span = input.nextElementSibling;
    if (input.value.trim().toLowerCase() === correctAnswer.toLowerCase()) {
        span.textContent = "✓ Correct";
        span.style.color = "green";
    } else {
        span.textContent = "";
    }
}

function showAnswers() {
    document.querySelectorAll('input[type="text"]').forEach(el => {
        const correct = el.getAttribute('oninput')?.match(/'([^']+)'/)?.[1];
        if (correct) {
            const span = el.nextElementSibling;
            span.textContent = `Réponse : ${correct}`;
            span.style.color = "blue";
        }
    });
}

function refreshPage() {
    location.reload();
}
</script>
```

#### 5. Translate into French (include articles!):

"We eat tofu with vegetables."\

```{=html}
<textarea placeholder="Nous mangeons..." rows="2" cols="50" oninput="checkTranslation(this, 'Nous mangeons du tofu avec des légumes')"></textarea>
```

"The salad has cucumber and tomatoes."\

```{=html}
<textarea placeholder="La salade a..." rows="2" cols="50" oninput="checkTranslation(this, 'La salade a du concombre et des tomates')"></textarea>
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Notes:

-   **Gender hints**: Most vegetables ending in *-e* are feminine (*la courgette*), but exceptions exist (*le gingembre*).\
-   **Plural alert**: *Épinards* (spinach) and *haricots verts* (green beans) are always plural. Other examples include *les choux de Bruxelles* (Brussels sprouts) and *les radis* (radishes).
:::
